title: Is social media to blame for rising antisemitism? | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Sunday's terror attack in Bondi has sent shockwaves around the world, with vigils held in places like the UK and US - countries that are also grappling with a rise in antisemitism. Author of 'Antisemitism, An American Tradition' Pamela Nadell tells The World's Girish Sawlani that social media is the "chief progenitor of antisemitism, not only in Australia and the US but around the world." title: Europe to launch international commission for Ukraine war damages | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Leaders including Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskyy arrived in The Hague on Tuesday to launch an International Claims Commission to compensate Kyiv for hundreds of billions of dollars in damage from Russian attacks and alleged war crimes. Human rights lawyer Oleksandra Matviichuk, who heads the Centre for Civil Liberties, which won the Nobel Peace Prize in 2022, tells The World's Girish Sawlani that breaking Russia's economy is what will help stop the war. title: How will Australia's gun laws change after Bondi? | The World | ABC NEWS
description: In the wake of the Bondi terrorist attack, state and territory leaders have unanimously agreed to strengthen gun controls. The National Cabinet is considering proposals to limit ownership further, restrict what guns are available for ownership, and how many a person can own. Professor Charles Watson from Gun Control Australia says the attack should make it next-to impossible to keep Australia's gun laws the way they are. title: AI and unchecked algorithms harming social cohesion, says expert | ABC NEWS
description: The Bondi attack saw social media flooded with misinformation and disinformation, in one instance from X's AI chatbot Grok which repeatedly misidentified a man captured in footage from the scene of the shooting. Alistair MacGibbon is the former national eSafety Commissioner, and he says social media companies and AI companies should be held responsible for a lack of social cohesion caused by the spread of misinformation. title: Bondi gunman's Indian family had no knowledge of his radicalisation, Indian police say | ABC News
description: Indian police say the dead gunman in the Bondi beach shooting, Sajid Akram, was originally from the southern Indian city of Hyderabad but had limited contact with his family in India. Indian correspondent Meghna Bali reports.  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Bondi Beach attacker Sajid Akram was of Indian origin, police say | ABC NEWS
description: Indian police have confirmed Sajid Akram, one of the two gunmen in the Bondi Beach terror attack, came from Hyderabad in southern India.  Reuters and Indian news agencies have reported the attacker left the country 25 years ago and became estranged from his Indian family after he married and settled in Australia in the late 90s.  His mother, father and brother claim to have had no knowledge of any extremist views and activities that he may have harboured. title: Body found in search for two missing fishermen off South Australia’s coast | ABC NEWS
description: The body of a 67-year-old man from Victoria has been retrieved from waters off South Australia during a search for two missing fishermen.  The two men disappeared after departing Cape Jaffa’s coast to collect craypots.  Their disappearance prompted a joint search and rescue effort by the Maritime Safety Authority , police and the SES.  Cape Jaffa is a popular destination for those seeking southern rock lobsters and crayfish. title: Liverpool parade attacker jailed for more than 21 years | ABC NEWS
description: Paul Doyle, the driver of a car which ploughed into a crowd during Liverpool’s Premier League victory parade has been sentenced to 21.5 years in prison.  More than 130 people were injured as victims say they have been left physically and emotionally scarred by the attack. title: Woman dies after allegedly targeted hit-and-run on Sunshine Coast | ABC NEWS
description: A 24-year-old woman who was struck in an allegedly deliberate hit-and-run in the Sunshine Coast’s Maroochydore has died in hospital.  38-year-old Guilherme Dal Bo allegedly veered his car into a group of pedestrians on a pavement after a minor altercation between him and six males in that group.  Mallee Smith was airlifted to the Royal Brisbane and Women's Hospital but could not be revived.  Queensland police say she and the other woman were unknown to the driver and the males. Guilherme Dal Bo has been charged with eight counts of attempted murder but police prosecutor Simon Evans said charges against him could be upgraded. title: IN FULL: Tom Silvagni sentenced for rape (may contain distressing content) | ABC News
description: Warning: This content may be distressing to some viewers. Victorian County Court Judge Greg Lyon sentenced Tom Silvagni to six years and two months prison with a non-parole period of three years and three months for the rape of woman.  While delivering his sentencing remarks, Judge Lyon referred to Silvagni's victim using a pseudonym, Samantha Taylor. This is not her real name. title: Nick Reiner to be charged with first-degree murder over his parents' deaths | ABC NEWS
description: Los Angeles prosecutors will charge the son of Hollywood film director Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner with two counts of first-degree murder. The couple were found dead in their Los Angeles home on Sunday. 32-year-old Nick Reiner was arrested several hours later. title: What military training could the Bondi shooters have got in Philippines? | ABC NEWS
description: Terrorism expert Dr Levi West says the shooters at Bondi Beach who reportedly visited the Philippines in the month before the terror attack could have received training from commercial and/or jihadist sources. Dr West says the simple purchase of an airline ticket to the Philippines would not set off alarm bells among authorities unless they were being specifically surveilled. title: Advocates concerned over ACT government wombat management plan | ABC NEWS
description: The ACT government is considering how to better manage and care for the territory's wombat population amid challenges being experienced by farmers and the prevalence of mange.  A draft technical report has made several recommendations, the first being to "support non-lethal methods for wombat control by land managers to mitigate damage".
